[b][color=white]Rise of The Phoenix[/color][/b]
A new usergroup has been launched this week. The group is called Phoenix and replaces the previous group, 143. The group was purchased by [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=651337][color=#EFEFEF][b]Tibit[/b][/color][/url] and [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1203712][color=#EFEFEF][b]iKinky[/b][/color][/url] from the previous owner [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1263952][color=#EFEFEF][b]Daisy ♡[/b][/color][/url]. [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1180170][color=#EFEFEF][b]Autopost[/b][/color][/url] was replaced by [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1203712][color=#EFEFEF][b]iKinky[/b][/color][/url] as [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=651337][color=#EFEFEF][b]Tibit's[/b][/color][/url] partner for Phoenix after violating the terms of their agreement, more can be found about the issue [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4369282][b]here[/b][/url]. [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=969003][color=#EFEFEF][b]'Sin[/b][/color][/url] and [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=649674][color=#EFEFEF][b]Eternal.[/b][/color][/url] also lead Phoenix with [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=651337][color=#EFEFEF][b]Tibit[/b][/color][/url] and [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1203712][color=#EFEFEF][b]iKinky[/b][/color][/url]. The group's description is "[i]We rise from the ashes of our past, strengthened by the flames, to light the way for all to see.[/i]" It is an invite-only group focused mainly on the innuendo section and helping members across the site. More can be found in their public thread, [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4366667][b]Rise of The Phoenix[/b][/url].

[b][color=white]Private Investigation Methods and Anonymity Section Now Open[/color][/b]
This Sunday, [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] opened the [url=http://hackforums.net/forumdisplay.php?fid=322][b]Private Investigation Methods and Anonymity[/b][/url] section. He [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4345150][b]stated in his thread[/b][/url] that the section is mainly focused on methods to obtain and secure personal data, not to release it. The rules are strictly enforced in the section. The main rules for the section are that you can't post private data or have any discussions on intimidation, threatening behavior, blackmailing, or physically harming anyone. [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] has also given $5 off per week of a sticky in the section currently, more on that [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4376070][b]here[/b][/url].

[b][color=white]HFNT - W4TCHL2ST - Recruiting Again[/color][/b]
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=515249][color=#EFEFEF][b]Sir[/b][/color][/url], leader of the HF News team, has recently announced a new wave of recruitment for the Writ3rs, the official usergroup responsible for running the HF News. All members of Writ3rs are required to be an Ub3r by [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url]. [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=515249][color=#EFEFEF][b]Sir[/b][/color][/url] has also stated that applicants must have excellent grammar, spelling, and comprehension of the English language as well as being knowledgeable of the happenings on Hack Forums. If you're interested in working on the HF News and meet the requirements, feel free to apply [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4310325][b]here[/b][/url].

[b][color=white]Rise of the Phoenix[/color][/b]
143 has burned itself out and Phoenix has risen from the ashes burning twice as bright to lead the way! Phoenix, owned by [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=651337][color=#EFEFEF][b]Tibit[/b][/color][/url], is Hack Forums' new invite only innuendo/help based group. The group is looking for "genuine and honest people for the group who will desire to be active, helpful, and an asset to the Hack Forums community," as stated by [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=649674][color=#EFEFEF][b]Eternal.[/b][/color][/url] in [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4366667&pid=41522818#pid41522818]this[/url] post. The group certainly came out in style, attracting a lot of attention and accumulating over a hundred posts on the informational thread (located [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4366667]here[/url]) in just one day. The group certainly has a successful future ahead for itself with loving members, [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1203712][color=#EFEFEF][b]iKinky[/b][/color][/url], [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=969003][color=#EFEFEF][b]'Sin[/b][/color][/url], and [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=649674][color=#EFEFEF][b]Eternal.[/b][/color][/url] leading the way. Be a helpful and genuine member and you just might get an invite.

[b][color=white]Call of the Void[/color][/b]
Out with the old, in with the new! Nexus has officially changed from its League of Legends-based manifesto to one many have previously enjoyed; philosophical debate and conversation. Group owner, [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=863752][color=#EFEFEF][b]Hexicidal[/b][/color][/url], has brought his group back to its roots this past week by renaming his group to L'appel du vide, which is French for 'call of the void.' If you remember, this group has previously been a SRPP based group twice before; Logic followed by Void. Many are excited for this change and await recruitment which will happen after the group finds an adequate userbar. If you would like to submit a userbar for the new group to use, head over [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4310295]here[/url].

[b][color=white]Another Online Wallet Presumably Hacked[/color][/b]
July 29th, at 10:49 PM, [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2099623]Vanish.[/url] posted [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4366601]a thread[/url] about some odd misbehavior on the online wallet, [url]omcwallet.com[/url]. He hadn't been able to send money from the wallet for the past 3 days. While not being the owner of the wallet, the user [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1256441]Abraham Lincoln[/url] decided to investigate the problem. It didn't take long before everyone realized that the wallet most likely had been hacked the same way the others were, effectively leaving no online wallets left for Omnicoin users. The owner of the wallet [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1901733]Boldheart[/url] has been sent a PM regarding the issue, but does not seem to have been online since July 17th.

[color=deepskyblue][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]Interview[/font][/size][/color] [color=white][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]-[/font][/size][/color] [size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1080516]Eric[/url][/font][/size][spoiler=]

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] Welcome to 204thd edition of the HF News, today we're here with Eric. Any shout-outs you'd like to make before we begin?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1080516][color=white][b]Eric‌:[/b][/color][/url] Yes, I'd like to make a shout-out to my niggas Cody, Daniel, Drew, Adam, Doc, and Jesse.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] Quiet a mix of people, how did you meet some of these hacker boys and the infamous self proclaimed hacker Cody aka JW aka swaglord?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1080516][color=white][b]Eric‌:[/b][/color][/url] I met some of them through AIM and PSN. But for Daniel and Cody, I've known them for about 3 years now. What once started as business deals, turned into great friendship. (full homo intended)

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] Well that's good to hear. You recently took a 6 month vacation from Hack Forums, what was the biggest change you noticed when you came back?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1080516][color=white][b]Eric‌:[/b][/color][/url] Well I tend to only go in the Marketplace here at HF so the biggest thing I noticed was the new "Online accounts" section. I am glad Omni implemented this and made it ub3r only. I was tired of seeing accounts being sold where they shouldn't have been.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] I kinda like the section because it makes it easier to find usernames. So what type of stuff do you do outside of the forum?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1080516][color=white][b]Eric‌:[/b][/color][/url] I'm a full time college student. I study software development and network engineering.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] Where do you plan on going with that? What would be your ideal dream job?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1080516][color=white][b]Eric‌:[/b][/color][/url] I am more interested in the security side things of my program, so I hope to do something such as a system/network security specialist or anything that involves helping other's with there IT related problems.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] Nice! Well I noticed you're pretty big in the "OG" market, how did you get into that stuff?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1080516][color=white][b]Eric‌:[/b][/color][/url] I originally joined a site called NGU (NextGenUpdate) in 2009 and I saw someone mention this site a couple of times. So when I first joined this site in November 2011, I was intrigued by these "OG Gamertags" people had for sale. I have never heard of them before, and I thought it would be so cool to own one.  So I began what any other new comer would do and I would start making accounts that I thought was "OG". Now I was a new member here and I knew that I wasn't trusted so I sold my "OG" accounts on NGU and then once I made enough money for l33t, I bought it and started to sell here. It took awhile to get the level of trust and respect I have today with people, but I just kept going at it. I would mainly buy things for low and flip them for profit, I was good at that.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] What kind of advice would you offer for someone breaking into that market?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1080516][color=white][b]Eric‌:[/b][/color][/url] The advice I would give to someone is for them to do their research on this "OG market", and what things have value and what things don't. Do not do what myself and others do when we first start and just assume what you have is OG, amazing, or has a lot of value. Also as sad as it is, buying a subscription such as l33t or ub3r is more likely to get you more trusted among the forums, although it is still very possible (but much harder)to do without it. Once you know what you want to get into, stick with it and keep going at it, even if it takes awhile.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] So you're a pretty big gamer, what are you playing?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1080516][color=white][b]Eric‌:[/b][/color][/url] I play PS3 and PS4 mostly. First person shooters are what I am best at.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] Are there any titles that you're looking forward to? I want a PS3, but there aren't enough games for me to want to buy one.
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1080516][color=white][b]Eric‌:[/b][/color][/url] Ya I can't wait for Dying Light to come out, its a mixture of first person parkour and and zombie killing lol.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] Sounds interesting, but not for me. So how would you rate your overall Hack Forums experience on a scale of 1-10?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1080516][color=white][b]Eric‌:[/b][/color][/url] I would rate it as a 7.5 imo. It's made me great cash and friends, but I have seen/experienced a lot of things that I dont mind not seeing again.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] If you could change one thing on site what would it be?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1080516][color=white][b]Eric‌:[/b][/color][/url] I would take the scamming more seriously and actually ban people who have been proven they are scammers.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] Well that's all the time we have for this interview. Are there any final remarks you'd like to make?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1080516][color=white][b]Eric‌:[/b][/color][/url] I would just like to thank you for the interview, and just say that Shrek is love, Shrek is life.
[/spoiler]

[color=deepskyblue][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]Interview[/font][/size][/color] [color=white][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]-[/font][/size][/color] [size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=398783]inxy[/url][/font][/size]
[spoiler=][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952870][color=#2E64FE][b]Alien:[/b][/color][/url] Welcome to the 204th edition of the HF News, today we're here with inxy. Any shout-outs you'd like to make before we begin?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=398783][color=#EFEFEF][b]inxy:[/b][/color][/url] I'd like to give a shout-out to Stefan Burnett and all the members of Instinct. I love every single one of you (except for Package).

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952870][color=#2E64FE][b]Alien:[/b][/color][/url] Ah, Package. Let's talk about that for a moment. For those who do not know, Package is the official mascot of Instinct. He receives a lot of criticism that's meant in jest. What are your thoughts on how he gets treated?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=398783][color=#EFEFEF][b]inxy:[/b][/color][/url] Package is a hoe, always trying to get inside of the meals of other members. I think he smokes rocks, real shit.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952870][color=#2E64FE][b]Alien:[/b][/color][/url] You have been on Hack Forums for over four years now. Have have you only managed to create 34 threads in that amount of time?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=398783][color=#EFEFEF][b]inxy:[/b][/color][/url] I'm too noided (paranoid) to be making threads out in public like that. I like staying in the Instinct SF, it makes me feel safe.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952870][color=#2E64FE][b]Alien:[/b][/color][/url] A lot of your posts involve sloths and you have a particular fascination with the YouTube video featuring a baby sloth getting a bath and [url=http://youtu.be/9BaUjMJUlSU]squeaking[/url]. How important are sloths in your life?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=398783][color=#EFEFEF][b]inxy:[/b][/color][/url] I have anxiety. Cute things like sloths or other cuddly animals calm me down when I'm feeling too noided.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952870][color=#2E64FE][b]Alien:[/b][/color][/url] Gotcha. You've accumulated quite a few posts, rep points, etc. in your time here. What milestone, accomplishment or stat are you most proud of?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=398783][color=#EFEFEF][b]inxy:[/b][/color][/url] I just hit 20,000 posts. Never thought I'd make this many, but then again... I've seen footage.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952870][color=#2E64FE][b]Alien:[/b][/color][/url] That's a lot of posts. Pretty soon you'll receive the 24k Award. Are you in school or college and where do you currently reside?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=398783][color=#EFEFEF][b]inxy:[/b][/color][/url] Yeah, I'll probably have that award soon unless junked posts are deleted. When you come out, your shit is gone. I consider myself a very private person, I don't wanna answer many personal life questions like that. I won't even tell people the year I was born.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952870][color=#2E64FE][b]Alien:[/b][/color][/url] I understand. Are there any personal details you wouldn't mind sharing? Perhaps what your hobbies are or what type of food you like to eat?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=398783][color=#EFEFEF][b]inxy:[/b][/color][/url] My favorite food is coconuts. My most favorite hobby is teaching bitches how to swim.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952870][color=#2E64FE][b]Alien:[/b][/color][/url] Let's switch the focus back to Hack Forums. Out of all of the groups you've been in or are in now, which have you enjoyed the most and why?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=398783][color=#EFEFEF][b]inxy:[/b][/color][/url] Sometimes I feel like a wheel, going into groups doing the best I can. The two I enjoy the most are Instinct and Illuminati. If you're in either of these groups then you've most likely seen me in your area.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952870][color=#2E64FE][b]Alien:[/b][/color][/url] There has been a lot of discussion on the site about the quality of groups lately. What sort of changes have you seen through the years regarding groups, or do you believe they operate and are ran pretty much the same as they always have been?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=398783][color=#EFEFEF][b]inxy:[/b][/color][/url] I don't think anything has changed. It's just that some leaders are laid back and others are only there to fuck me out with activity checks all the time. Stimulation overload.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952870][color=#2E64FE][b]Alien:[/b][/color][/url] That's an interesting take on things. Is there anything we did not discuss today that you'd like to bring up?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=398783][color=#EFEFEF][b]inxy:[/b][/color][/url] I'm on 4chan's /mu/ board a lot. My favorite artists are Death Grips, Neautral Milk Hotel, The Mars Volta, Sufjan Stevens, Mac DeMarco, and Radiohead.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952870][color=#2E64FE][b]Alien:[/b][/color][/url] Noted. Maybe you'll receive some contacts from HF members on there now. Is there anything else or does that about cover it?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=398783][color=#EFEFEF][b]inxy:[/b][/color][/url] You'll be alright.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952870][color=#2E64FE][b]Alien:[/b][/color][/url] Well I thank you for your time and participation in this interview. I appreciate all the detailed responses and hope you enjoy the rest of your day.
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=398783][color=#EFEFEF][b]inxy:[/b][/color][/url] You'll be alright.[/spoiler]

[align=center]By [b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1173142][color=#EFEFEF]Goodies[/color][/url][/b][/align]
[align=center][spoiler=][align=left]

[b][color=white]Bleep - BitTorrent's Decentralized, Encrypted Instant Messenger[/color][/b]
BitTorrent has created a Peer to Peer (P2P) voice and text communication system that provides complete encryption and privacy. Unlike various other IM programs (Skype, Google Hangouts, etc), Bleep is decentralized and provides true anonymity to its users. Unfortunately, the program is in its Pre-Alpha stage and is only allowing a very select group of Invite-Only users to try it out. However, it is supposed to be released within a couple of months (unfortunately not in time for Defcon!) and I, among thousands of others, am excited for its release!

[b][color=white]Defcon 22 This Weekend![/color][/b]
It is my hope that I will meet several HackForums members at Defcon 22. Defcon is the largest worldwide hacking and security convention that will take place August 7-10 at the Rio Hotel & Casino in Las Vegas, Nevada. Defcon is well-known to be the pinnacle of hacker community congregation. Several speakers will talk about a wide array of subjects from Kernel Exploits, Return Oriented Programming, Physical Security, Software Defined Radio, and many others. Tickets cost $220 (cash only at the door) and I, along with thousands of other hackers and security experts or enthusiasts, have been awaiting this for months. I will be writing the next edition of Hacking News from Defcon! Hope to see you there!
[/align][/spoiler][/align]

[align=center][img]http://i.imgur.com/Gm7w7ET.png[/img][/align]

[align=center][b]By [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=255459]Delirium™[/url][/b][/align]
[align=center][spoiler=][align=left]

[b][color=white]Major Companies Still Suffering From The Heartbleed Bug[/color][/b]
It's been a few months since the discovery of the Heartbleed bug, yet, a very large amount of large companies still suffer from the aforementioned security hole. According to  research by a security company named Venafi, 97% of the public-facing servers of big companies are still vulnerable to the Heartbleed bug. "Hackers can still exploit the security breach and steal data that is transmitted over SSL. Thousands of applications behind firewalls, including those of Cisco, Juniper, HP, IBM, Oracle, McAfee, Symantec and many more, are still exposed" the report says. To conclude, Venafi researchers stated that to fix the bug, installing a patch is not enough but the replacement of keys and certificates is required as well.

[b][color=white]Stolen Laptop From Self Regional Healthcare Exposes Patient Data[/color][/b]
A burglary in the facilities of the Self Regional Healthcare has resulted in the theft of a laptop containing sensitive data for a vast amount of patients. The incident occurred in May and was discovered by employees two days after the fact. The burglars, who were arrested, confessed the crime and informed the local authorities that the laptop has been dropped into a lake and is now destroyed. According to a police report, the laptop contains patient information such as names, social security numbers, driver license numbers, the name of the doctor supervising the patient, patient bank account numbers and diagnostic information. 

[b][color=white]Internet Explorer: New Vulnerability Record For The First Half Of 2014[/color][/b]
One of the most (if not the most) notorious web browsers, Internet Explorer, has achieved a new record when it comes to the number of vulnerabilities. According to information by the National Vulnerability Database, Internet Explorer was vulnerable to 133 security holes for the first half of 2014 while, in 2013, the number of security holes was 130. The exact opposite has been the case for Google Chrome and Mozilla Firefox, which appear to be vulnerable to 50 exploits whereas, the amount was 200 and 150 respectively in 2013. This research shows how other browsers have improved their security, while Internet Explorer, which was indeed a major competitor for the aforementioned browsers, has had a major decline regarding its integrity issues.
[/align][/spoiler][/align]

[align=center][img]http://i.imgur.com/TvznEMg.png[/img][/align]

[align=center][b]By [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1698590]Abide[/url] & [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1079277]Harlem[/url][/b][/align]
[align=center][spoiler=][align=left]

[b][color=white]Tesla Plans To Install Charging Stations That Will Cover 98% Of The US Population By 2015[/color][/b]
While Tesla is still a thing that has to really catch on, they see growth in their future. Tesla feels that customers do not want to buy an EV (Electric Vehicle) in fear of running out of power in the middle of nowhere with no way to get home. Tesla’s CEO Elon Musk wanted to put these fears to rest, though. He says that Tesla will have Supercharger stations all over the US, that could be easily reached by 98% of the US population. Included in this discussion was a GIF of Tesla’s charging station locations (see below), showing how many would actually be put in place by then. As of right now, there is only about 103 around the US. Tesla plans to have these put in in hopes that most people would get rid of their regular cars in place of a more environmentally friends electric vehicle. The US isn't the only place where they are planning for expansion, though. Elon Musk briefly stated that they would be expanding in both Europe and Asia soon. He didn't go into detail on the European aspect of it, but he said that they already have stations slated to be built in China.

If you would like to see a map of the charging station locations, click [url=http://i.imgur.com/Q8qL0c0.gif]here.[/url]

[b][color=white]XBMC Ditches Xbox Roots, Renames Media App[/color][/b]
XBMC got its start in the Xbox world, Xbox literally being in its name. XBMC happens to stand for Xbox Media Center, and while it was big a while ago, it seems to hold little to no relevance these days. The entertainment platform is coming back to life now though, with its new branding. The new platform will be called Kodi Entertainment Center, and it will start rolling out on V14.0 of the media center. The creators of Kodi say that the new name is because it is a little more universal and less prone to legal issues from the guys over at Microsoft. The development team also now have full control over their trademark, so it makes it easier for them to protect their assets in the event that other companies do come for them. More information and where to get Kodi can be found at [url=http://xbmc.org/introducing-kodi-14/]this link.[/url]

[b][color=white]Google’s Floating Barge Will Be No More[/color][/b]
A while back, several news sources covered the mysterious barge owned by Google that came out of nowhere. The barge itself was parked in the Portland Harbor and was a four-story structure, originally designed to be a showroom for Google’s new inventions. It would allow people to come out and check all the new stuff out and see the advancements Google had made so far. Alas, the barge has come to an end now. The company sold the barge to an anonymous international barging company where it will be broken down and taken away for scrap. Google did not disclose much more about it, nor did they divulge whether they were going to be working on a showroom somewhere else. We expect more news to come at a later time.

[/align][/spoiler][/align]

[align=center][b]By [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1093501]Roger Waters[/url] & [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1030620]CyborgIzSoBeast[/url][/b][/align]
[align=center][spoiler=][align=left]

[b][color=white]The Colin McRae Game [/color][/b]
Codemasters’ Colin McRae Rally launched on Steam earlier this week for $6.99, but it’s probably not the game you’re hoping for. Though the game’s description on Steam says it’s based on content from the 90 percent Metacritic rated Colin McRae Rally 2.0 originally released on the first PlayStation, it’s actually a port of the mobile version of the game released in 2013 (which has a Metacritic score of 69 percent). The game’s trailer also says that it’s been “remastered for HD,” and that it includes “original cars and locations.” Add to that the fact that it only mentions the mobile version once in the "About the Game" section, and one could easily come to the wrong conclusion that he or she is buying an HD remake of the classic PlayStation game.

[b][color=white]Xbox teases Gamescom 2014 announcements with trailer[/color][/b]
Microsoft announced this week that Xbox's press conference at Gamescom 2014 will take place at 1 PM GMT on August 12, 2014. The event will be live streamed on all Microsoft platforms: Xbox Live, Xbox.com, Windows Phone, and even through Xbox's Twitch channel. The company did not announce what would be showcased during the briefing, but stated that it would contain  ”biggest reveals and the hottest highlights.” In a video linked below, they also tease that there will be ”big surprises you will not want to miss” throughout Gamescom. Sony is expected to have its own press conference on the same day at 6 PM GMT, Square Enix's press conference is expected to follow that on August 13, 2014.

[align=center][sp=Xbox Gamescom 2014 Teaser Video][yt]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hPL2ErQRIvs[/yt][/sp][/align]

[b][color=white]Dead Island Movie Back in Development[/color][/b]
Publisher Deep Silver is taking another attempt at making its zombie game Dead Island into a movie. According to Deadline, Deep Silver has partnered with Occupant Entertainment to package, produce, and finance a movie based on the game, set on a paradise island infested with the undead. “The Dead Island universe offers a rich and unique setting that can expand beyond the pure gaming experience,” Deep Silver owner Koch Media CEO Dr. Klemens Kundratitz said. “We are very much looking forward to seeing Dead Island open up to new audiences and showing off the fun everybody at Deep Silver has with this brand.” If the news sounds a little familiar it’s because Deep Silver made a similar deal with Lionsgate back in 2011, though that project fell through. When the rights reverted back to Deep Silver, it took the project to Occupant, which was one of the original bidders.

[b][color=white]Destiny’s six-player raids can only be played with friends[/color][/b]
It was revealed this week that Destiny's six-player raids will be a friends-only feature for matchmaking, and you cannot just be teamed up with a few strangers through matchmaking. According to writer Luke Smith, "Raids will be the most difficult content in Destiny and may take a couple of hours to complete,  the decision to limit it to friends only is “a bit of a risk” because it requires players to have five other friends available to play the content with. The activity is going to take you and your group of five buddies into a place that you’ve never been,” he told IGN. “A place that you will return to frequently. And [it will] demand of you things you’ve never even really been asked to do in a shooter before.” Destiny is set to be released in a little over a month, on September 9, 2014 for the Play Station 3, Play Station 4, Xbox 360 and Xbox One platforms.

[b][color=white]Flappy Bird Returns With Multiplayer[/color][/b]
As creator Dong Nguyen promised, Flappy Bird has returned. A new version of the massively popular mobile game is now available on Amazon Fire TV, presumably before a wider release for iOS and Android devices. The new version of Flappy Bird is called Flappy Birds Family. This new version includes new features like a Person vs. Person mode and, as if the standard green pipes weren't challenging enough, additional obstacles (ghosts) to avoid. The game is still "very hard," according to the description. Flappy Birds Family is compatible with Amazon's proprietary video game controller and the Fire TV remote.When Nguyen announced in May that Flappy Bird would return, he said the new version would be "less addictive." One of the first reviews for Flappy Bird Family says this goal has been met. "This version is not as addictive as the original, and for that I am thankful!" wrote one reviewer. Nguyen removed the game from iTunes and Google Play in February after writing on Twitter: "I cannot take this anymore." The decision to pull the game was a serious one, as the title was pulling in an average of $50,000 in daily ad revenue.

[b][color=white]Xbox Live causing Xbox 360 game launch issues[/color][/b]
According Microsoft’s Xbox Live Status page, there are problems with the Xbox Live service that will cause issues with your Xbox 360 while launching games. “It’s come to our attention that some of you are seeing a black screen when attempting to launch games and applications,” reads the status update from this week. “Hang in there, Xbox members, we’re on it! Thanks for your patience while we work to resolve this issue. We’ll update you again as soon as we have more information.” It appears that the rest of Xbox Live's services, such as music and video streaming as well as applications and the marketplace, are not effected by this issue. A workaround for this was found that you can launch the game while you are disconnected from Xbox Live and then connect to Xbox Live once the game has been launched. 

[b][color=white]Release Dates for the Week of August 3, 2014:[/color][/b]
[list]
[*]Sacred 3 - PC, Play Station 3, Xbox 360 - August 5, 2014
[*]Table Top Racing - Play Station Vita - August 5, 2014
[*]Ultra Street Fighter IV - Play Station 3, Xbox 360 - August 5, 2014
[*]Ultra Street Fighter IV - PC - August 8, 2014
[/list]

[align=center][b]By [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1431113]Antigen[/url][/b][/align]
[align=center][spoiler=][align=left]

[b][color=white]Apple iPhone 6 Tipped to launch on September 9[/color][/b]
Renowned technology reporter [url=http://recode.net/2014/08/05/codered-apple-to-hold-iphone-event-on-sept-9/]Re/code[/url] recently reported that Apple may unveil much anticipated iPhone 6 at a media event on Tuesday, September 9. iPhone 6 is said to be available to customers after one week and half later on the corresponding Friday, September 19. iPhone 6 is expected to feature larger displays of "4.7" and "5.5" inches and an improved camera. Along with a larger screen sizes, the iPhone 6 may feature durable sapphire display and new speedy processor. There were early reports that 5.5-inch iPhone 6 version was experiencing production issues and may ship on a later date. Apple declined comment on this report.

[b][color=white]HTC One M8 with Windows 8.1 is on the way[/color][/b]
HTC's flagship phone One M8 is soon to be released with Windows 8.1. Graphic render of it has been spotted on the server's of Verizon, reported by PCmag. Unveiling is to be expected on August 21, immediately after a press event conducted by HTC in New York on August 19. Apparently the device would come in silver and would be identical to the Android version. One M8 with Windows will be the first major Windows OS for Verizon since HTC 8X. Microsoft and HTC declined to comment on this report. [spoiler]

[b][color=white]What the Duck is duckNote?[/color][/b]
duckNote is a relatively recent cryptocurrency, which utilises [url=https://cryptonote.org]CryptoNote[/url] to enable its offering of anonymous and untraceable transactions. The currency is resistant to analysis and blockchain tracking, making it preferable for those users requiring anonymity with their online transactions. Like the massively successful Bitcoin, duckNote employs a distribution system whereby the block rewards are halved every 11,000 blocks, down to a lowest reward value of 150 XDN. Block rewards start at an impressive 320,000 duckNotes. However, the main thing that makes duckNote so appealing to crypto-fanatics is that it is ASIC-resistant. The duckNote work algorithm means that GPU mining is inefficient, both in terms of energy and hardware costs. The currency is optimised to be mined solely through CPU work, a feature long desired by many users of crytpocurrencies. For more information, check out the [url=http://ducknote.org]duckNote website[/url].

[b][color=white]Stripe with Stellar: A Serious Currency Contender[/color][/b]
One thing stopping Bitcoin, the worlds largest cryptocurrency, from achieving total mainstream use is that fact that it has no method of support for traditional, real-world currencies. Spotting an opportunity, small Irish firm Stripe is attempting to content with Bitcoin through their newly backed currency, Stellar. Stripe have invested $3,000,000 USD into the Stellar currency, in return for 2% of all Stellar coins. Stellar allows payments to be sent and received in a variety of different currency pairs, including Bitcoin. This would allow an individual to pay using Bitcoins, and the seller would be able to accept that transaction as if the payment was sent in any other mainstream currency, such as USD, EUR, GBP and JPY. Supporting both Bitcoin and real world currency, could Stellar be the next serious contender in the digital currency market?

[b][color=white]The Changing Face of the Dollar[/color][/b]
Barrack Obama said last week that it would be a 'pretty good idea' to replace the line-up of revered and respected past presidents, with more women. Whilst Congress have jurisdiction over minting coins and their designs, an act of Congress passed in 1862 gives the power of paper-currency design to the secretary of the Treasury. As of yet, it is unsure whether plans are to introduce new denominations of currency, or simply rid an existing denomination of it's beloved president. Due to the 2001 Legal Tender Modernization Act, changing the design of the $1 bill is prohibited, but no such rules exist for all other denominations. In the history of the US Dollar, only four women have ever appeared on any official currency. This discussion was prompted by a letter from a young Massachusetts girl, sent to Obama's office. Treasury officials have expressed concern over the suggestion, citing the fact that the USD is the 'de facto world currency', and that any alteration of its design would be likely to confuse non-US users of the currency. The Treasury stated that they have no plans to introduce new denominations of currency, suggesting that if this were to be implemented, it would have to be existing currency that was modified.

[b][color=white]Targeting Brain Cancer in Children[/color][/b]
Previous studies have suggested that a pregnant mother's exposure to carcinogens can be linked to brain tumors later in the child's life. Complementing this is new research suggesting that a father's exposure to similar carcinogens before fertilization can have equally as great of an impact. The research team compared environmental factors of 306 cases of children with tumors versus 950 children without tumors and found that fathers who work in close proximity to carcinogens were twice as likely to have a child develop a brain tumor. The researchers suggest that couples should weigh possible environmental factors before planning for parenthood. 

[b][color=white]Researchers Eliminate HIV in Cell Cultures[/color][/b]
HIV is one of the world's most deadly diseases to humans and is also one of the most difficult to cure. However, significant steps have been made in developing an effective cure for this debilitating disease. For the first time ever, a team of researchers has managed to remove all traces of latent HIV from living cells in a culture. The team used a combination of a nuclease and targeting RNA to hunt down and remove portions of HIV's DNA from infected cells, allowing the body's DNA-repairing mechanisms to take over. The success  of the experiment in living cells may help accelerate the possible treatment to animal and human trials.

[b][color=white]Transparent Mice[/color][/b]
Most of what we know about anatomy is done through dissection studies, where dead organisms a sliced apart and their insides examined. This creates room for inaccuracies, as cutting and reassembling a body can move things out of place. A new technique developed by joint work between Stanford and Caltech researchers provides an interesting new tool for anatomical studies. The team used a combination of a transparent gel and a detergent to remove lipids from a dead mouse, leaving it transparent. Fluorescent dyes can then be injected into organ systems to map microstructures. The Caltech group plans to use this new method to map the nervous system. 

[b][color=white]Cultural Influences on Schizophrenia[/color][/b]
One of the most well-known symptoms of schizophrenia is the presence of auditory hallucinations, most often in the form of voices. An anthropologist from Stanford has found evidence that the voices are shaped by the culture a person lives in. Patients in individualist societies, such as the US, reported hearing harsh, degrading voices, while patients living in community-based collectivist cultures, such as India and Africa, experienced more pleasant, playful voices. This disparity has been suggested to have clinical implications for psychotherapy across cultures.

[b][color=white]African Ebola Outbreak Has Worsened[/color][/b]
Two Americans, who were returning home from a trip to West Africa, have contracted the Ebola virus. The first patient is estimated to reach the U.S on Saturday afternoon. Both patients are expected to be held at Emory University Hospital in Atlanta, Georgia. The “Emory Unit”, which was created in association with the CDC, will care for these patients and is purposed to care for those who have contracted infectious diseases. Dr. Bruce Ribner has stated that many safety precautions have been put in place to prevent the spread of the Ebola virus. This includes monitoring and controlling anything that comes in and out of the unit. “I have no concerns about either my personal health or the health of other health care workers who will be working in that unit” said Ribner. Many experts have said that other people with the virus will most likely come to the U.S in time. The symptoms of Ebola, which start out like other common diseases including the common flu, then further progress to abdominal pain and extensive bleeding. The National Health Institute stated on Thursday that it will begin to test an experimental Ebola vaccine in humans as early as September. Currently, West Africa is facing an Ebola outbreak with over 1200 cases and 600 plus deaths since March. This virus is among the most deadly ever discovered. Up to 90% of people infected are killed by the disease. It is generally an unfortunate and gruesome death consisting of internal bleeding and severe fever. If caught early however, death from Ebola can be prevented, and it is difficult to pass on the virus unknowingly. One must show symptoms before transferring it which usually happens through either waste or bodily fluids (blood). The likelihood of it spreading to the western world is slim to none. Anyone showing feverish symptoms at an airport where the outbreak currently is at will be tested to see if they are safe to travel out of the region.

[b][color=white]8/4/14 - International Tiger Day[/color][/b]

Overall, tigers have lost about 90% of their original habitat due to human interference and deforestation. Of about 100,000 tigers that were alive 100 years ago, only about 3000 of their species remain today. Several tiger species are already extinct, and the number is only growing. Humans and tigers are currently competing for space. Obtaining lumber and resources can be very difficult when at risk of tiger attacks, and tigers that create problems typically end up dead with their fur on the black market.

Selena Gomez was involved in a minor car accident. She was pulling out of an event on a Sunday afternoon when she changed vehicles, and her SUV was reported as taking minor damage. No injuries were reported due to this incident. Gomez blames the paparazzi. Later that day she made a tweet stating 'Only I'd get into an accident because of men with cameras who have great careers and offer the couple a package at Burke Williams. Oh LA.' Perhaps 2014 hasn't been the best year for the singer, checking into rehab early in the year and being haunted by paparazzi since. Gomez denied that the reason was due to substance abuse.

[b][color=white]Lorde Appointed as 'sole curator' of next Hunger Games Film[/color][/b]
The supposedly final film to be published from the Hunger Games series appoints 17 year old Lorde as 'sole curator'. She is responsible for recording its lead single. The singer states that she is "so pleased and proud" to be given this opportunity. Lawrence stated in a statement that she was "immediately struck" by the way Lorde understood what they were trying to achieve with the film. With two hit songs, Lorde has obviously started off her career with a bang. Time will only tell what she brings to the stage for the next Hunger Games. The film is due to be released November of 2014.

[b][color=white]iBeats[/color][/b]
Apple has announced that it has acquired Beats Electronics and Beats Music for the sum of $3 billion, two months after declaring its interest in the company. This deal was finalized on the 1st of August after being approved by the US government. Apple CEO Tim Cook made a tweet shortly after saying "Welcome to the family---Jimmy, Dre, Luke, Ian and the entire beats team!". Beats has always been known for selling expensive gear, and sometimes turned to as the best for audio, even at its expensive price. Apple also has a high price tag on its items, and its recent acquisition of Beats Electronics should be a useful asset to the company.

[b][color=white]Ed Sheeran Reveals New Video For 'Don't'[/color][/b]
Ed Sheeran has revealed a new music video for his new single 'Don't'. The singer's new single features a man's journey from poor to rich through a number of encounters with LA citizens. The track is due to release on the 24th of August in the UK. Later this year, Sheeran is going on a national tour for the first time since Autumn 2012.

[b][color=white]Spotify Adds An Equalizer Feature[/color][/b]
Spotify has added a new feature to the iOS and Android apps to allow users to adjust the music with an equalizer. This was one of the most requested features for Spotify so far, and there are 17 pages of threads asking for Spotify to add this feature since 2012. There are multiple presets to choose from including acoustic, flat, piano, and more.

[align=center]By [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1754936][color=#EFEFEF][b]Vince‍[/b][/color][/url] & [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1422600][color=#EFEFEF][b]Fox™[/b][/color][/url][/align]
[align=center][spoiler=][align=left]

[b][color=white]Jamie Foxx to star in Mike Tyson biopic[/color][/b]
Portraying the baddest man to ever walk on earth will not be easy, but it is a task that Jamie Foxx is looking to take on as he stars in an upcoming Mike Tyson biopic. Production has not yet started on the motion film, as the script and supporting cast is still in the works. Terrence Winter is said to be the man penning the script for the biopic. Winter is known for his script that brought The Wolf Of Wall Street from the pages of a book to the big screen. The report has no word on which elements of Tyson’s life the film will focus upon, but given the boxer’s “colorful” career, there should be plenty of incidents to choose from. The project is currently without a studio, although Foxx’s manager, Rick Yorn, is acting as producer, and charged with bringing the core elements together to present to distributors. There is no set release date. 

[b][color=white]Paul Feig set to direct new female-led [i]Ghostbusters [/i]film[/color][/b]
With plenty of shake ups from the original film, Sony Pictures is looking to change things up from our beloved [i]Ghostbusters[/i] films. Sony is said to be targeting Paul Feig to direct and produce a new female-led Ghostbusters film. Feig is understood to be the frontrunner for the job but formal negotiations have yet to begin. However, Feig has expressed an interest in directing and producing the film. Feig is mostly known for his hit movies [i]Bridesmaids[/i] and [i]The Heat[/i]. It was reported that the film will not be a sequel to the original 1980's Ghostbusters films, which starred Bill Murray, Dan Aykroyd and Harold Ramis as a team of parapsychology professors tackling paranormal activity in New York, but will instead be a complete reboot, with a fresh plot and cast. Also rumored, the film is likely to be led by an all-female team of [i]Ghostbusters[/i]. Ivan Reitman, who directed [i]Ghostbusters[/i] (1984) and [i]Ghostbusters II[/i] (1989) was in line to direct the next installment of the franchise but backed out after the death of Ghostbusters actor Harold Ramis in February of this year.

[b][color=white]Studio Ghibli may stop making films[/color][/b]
For all you anime fans out there, this may come as a shock and something that will deeply sadden you. It is rumored that [i]When Marnie Was There[/i] may be Studio Ghibli's final film, if rumors of the Japanese animation studio's imminent closure are true. Studio co-founder Hayao Miyazaki retired last summer, after completing [i]The Wind Rises[/i]. Earlier this year co-founder and producer Toshio Suzuki stopped producing films and became Ghibli's general manager. This started the change and shift in direction of the studio itself. Although the reports are unconfirmed, it is rumored that financial problems are the reason that [i]When Marnie Was There[/i] would be Ghibli's final film before they just "manage the copyrights", or make money from, their older material. A source was cited saying "There's no choice but to dissolve the studio, because it's unable cross the high hurdle of announcing a new film on an annual basis."

[b][color=white]Tom Felton and Joseph Fiennes starring in Bible epic[/color][/b]
Tom Felton, better known as Draco Malfoy from [i]Harry Potter[/i], and Joseph Fiennes are soon to star in a Bible epic. The film will be set fifty days after the death and resurrection of Jesus Christ. Events will detail the Roman centurion, who was sent out by Pontius Pilate to lead an investigation on Jesus's death, locate Jesus's missing body, and stop a developing rebellion. Throughout this quest, Clavius, although agnostic, begins to believe in the resurrection. Unfortunately not much else is known about the film, including Felton's position; it is noted that he is definitely going to be a large role in the film.

[b][color=white][i]Guardians Of The Galaxy[/i] Conquers Box Office[/color][/b]
Marvel film [i]Guardians Of The Galaxy[/i] surpassed the expectations of many. The film banked $94 Million from the United States alone and $160+ Million worldwide. On top of such a haul, the film has placed itself at the top of any other August (US) film releases. The album’s soundtrack, [i]Awesome Mix Volume 1[/i], has also topped music charts following the film’s release. Plans for a sequel, as well as integration with other Marvel films, are underway.

[b][color=white]Meryl Streep and Johnny Depp star in trailer for [i]Into The Woods[/i][/color][/b]
Actress Meryl Streep and actor Johnny Depp are seen in the teaser trailer for the new Disney movie [i]Into The Woods[/i]. The trailer doesn't seem to hint much on what the soundtrack will be like, but it's expected to contain a wide variety of songs. While this is the first trailer, and not a huge amount is known about the film, it has been announced that the film will be out January 1st of 2015. With that, I'll leave you with the link to the [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7QEW3u-bEtY]trailer[/url].
[/align][/spoiler][/align]
